Firescars with distance from highways in Interior Alaska (1994-1999)

Precipitation is measured at many sites within BCEF using TE525 tipping buckets. These sensors are able to detect .254mm of precipitation and record hourly totals of rainfall or throughfall. It should be noted the tipping buckets within forested sites are subject to clogging by forest debris whcih can result in under reporting of rain events as well as over reporting upon release of the collected precipitation. There is data from floodplains to upland sites along a range of successional gradients.

doc.str: Bonanza Creek Experimental Forest: Hourly Precipitation data, 1988 to Present

This data file contains data for changes in snow melt, snow return, and total snow cover duration as modeled with the Terrestrial Ecosystem Model for the area north of 50 degrees north latitude around the entire globe for the years 1910-1940. See Euskirchen et al. (2007) for full study details.

arr.name: attribute
arr.str: snowreturn_anomaly snowreturn_anomaly change in snow return (anomaly) between the years 1910 - 1940
snowmelt_anomaly snowmelt_anomaly change in snow melt (anomaly) between the years 1910 - 1940
total_anomaly total_anomaly sum of the data in columns c and d; total change in snow cover duration between the years 1910 - 1940

arr.name: attributeDescription
arr.str: change in snow return (anomaly) between the years 1910 - 1940
change in snow melt (anomaly) between the years 1910 - 1940
sum of the data in columns c and d; total change in snow cover duration between the years 1910 - 1940

arr.name: site
arr.str: Circumpolar for the area north of 50 N latitude. Used in a variety of modeling data.

This file contains the 14C content of tussock tundra vegetation from 2002-2006. The 14C labeling occurred the summer of 2002.

arr.name: attribute
arr.str: Vegetation Vegetation Vegetation Type: t = tussock tundra | w = wet sedge
Treatment Treatment Treatment Type: c = control | f = fertilized
Plot# Plot# Plot Number: 1 = plot 1 | 2 = plot 2 | 3 = plot 3
Location Location Where the sample was taken within a plot: AG = Above Ground | BG = Below Ground
ulti-date</field>est_Date Date of the harvest in dd-mmm-yy and multi-date

Species Species Sample Species: Bet nan = Betula nana| Cas tet = Cassiope tetragona| Emp nig = Empetrum nigrum| E. ang = Eriophorum angustifolium| Eri vag = Eriophorum vaginatum| Led pal = Ledum palustre| Lichens = Lichen| Misc = Miscellaneous| Moss = Moss| Mushroom = Mushroom| Gram oth = Other Graminoid| Rub cha = Rubus chamaemorus| Other = Unknown| Vac vit = Vaccinium vitis-idaea

Tissue Tissue Sample Tissue: Aboveground Stem | Belowground Stem | Blade | Coarse Roots | Coarse Roots(>.5) | Fine Roots | Foliar N | Green | Influor. | Leaves | Leaves/Wood | Litter | Litter/stand.dead | Other | Rhizomes | Roots | Sheath | Standing Dead | Stembase | Stem/Leaves | Wood
Core_Depth_cm Core_Depth_cm Depth of core (if a below ground sample) in Centimeters
Specific_activity_Bq_mg Specific_activity_Bq_mg Specific Activity, Becquerel of 14C per mg of plant material becquerelPerMilligram

arr.name: attributeDescription
arr.str: Vegetation Type: t = tussock tundra | w = wet sedge
Treatment Type: c = control | f = fertilized
Where the sample was taken within a plot: AG = Above Ground | BG = Below Ground
Date of the harvest in dd-mmm-yy and multi-date

Sample Species: Bet nan = Betula nana| Cas tet = Cassiope tetragona| Emp nig = Empetrum nigrum| E. ang = Eriophorum angustifolium| Eri vag = Eriophorum vaginatum| Led pal = Ledum palustre| Lichens = Lichen| Misc = Miscellaneous| Moss = Moss| Mushroom = Mushroom| Gram oth = Other Graminoid| Rub cha = Rubus chamaemorus| Other = Unknown| Vac vit = Vaccinium vitis-idaea

Sample Tissue: Aboveground Stem | Belowground Stem | Blade | Coarse Roots | Coarse Roots(>.5) | Fine Roots | Foliar N | Green | Influor. | Leaves | Leaves/Wood | Litter | Litter/stand.dead | Other | Rhizomes | Roots | Sheath | Standing Dead | Stembase | Stem/Leaves | Wood
